page.title: 08A HARWICH EMPLOYER-BERNARDS
page.content: LOCAL EMPLOYERS BERNARDS BEGAN BUSINESS IN 1896,THE OWNER BEING MR CHARLES HENRY FIRTH BERNARD.THE FACTORY TODAY MAKES UNIFORMS FOR THE POLICE,FIREBRIGADE,AMBULANCE SERVICE,ARMED FORCES AND SECURITY FIRMS.IT IS OWNED BY A PRIVATE BUSINESSMAN FROM LONDON.IN CHARGE OF THE FACTORY ARE MR WALKIN AND MR COBB.THE FACTORY IS DIVIDED UP INTO DIFFERENT SECTIONS;THE MAIN SECTION IS THE GROUND FLOOR,WHERE THEY STITCH THE UNIFORMS TOGETHER.UPSTAIRS IS THE CUTTING ROOM WHERE THEY SHAPE OUT THE UNIFORMS.THE MINISTRY OF DEFENCE SUPPLIES THE MATERIAL FOR BERNARDS. THERE ARE 166 WORKERS AND MOST OF THEM ARE WOMEN.THERE ARE ABOUT 500_700 UNIFORMS LEAVING THE FACTORY EVERYDAY. THE FACTORY WORKS FROM 8-5 EVERYDAY AND 8-1.30 ON FRIDAYS.
